entropy.configuration

Class ConfigurationGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • entropy.configuration.ConfigurationGenerator

  • public class ConfigurationGenerator
extends Object
    modifies a configuration.
    Each newly added element is named using the number of already added nodes or VMs. ie, if there already are 20 nodes, next node will be named "node21".
    This default behavior can be modified using
    • to set the nodes names :
      • resetNodeIdx() reset the index of nodes to 0
      • setNodeConverter(IdxConverter) change the conversion of index to string
      • setNodePrefix(String) changes the prefix of the nodes
    • to set the VMs names :
      • resetVMIdx() reset the index of vms to 0
      • setVMConverter(IdxConverter) change the conversion of index to string
      • setVmPrefix(String) changes the prefix of the vms
    Author:
    guillaume

      • addVMs

        public ConfigurationGenerator addVMs(int num,
                            int cpuUsage,
                            int memSize,
                            boolean running)
        add VMs on last added nodes. Each VM uses 1 CPU.
        Parameters:
        num - number of VM per node
        memSize - the size of the memory used by each VM
        cpuUsage - the MHz usage of CPU each VM consumes
        running - true to set the VMs running on the node, or false to set it waiting.
        Returns:
        this

      • addRunnings

        public ConfigurationGenerator addRunnings(int num,
                                 int cpuUsage,
                                 int memSize)
        add a given number of running VMs on last added nodes.
        short for addVMs(int, int, int, boolean) with last to true;

      • distributeVMs

        public ConfigurationGenerator distributeVMs(Collection<VirtualMachine> vms)
        allocates a collection of VMs on the last added nodes in round-robin. if we added N nodes, then vms[i] will be running on node N%i
        Parameters:
        vms -
        Returns:

      • addCluster

        public ConfigurationGenerator addCluster(Node[] nodeModels,
                                String[][] nodeNames,
                                VirtualMachine[] vmModels,
                                String[][][][] vmNames)
        add a cluster of Servers and VMs to the configuration.
        the nodes and VMs added to the Configuration are also put in getLastAddedNodes() and getLastAddedVMs()
        Parameters:
        nodeModels - the models to add to the cfg
        nodeNames - for each node model, the names of corresponding nodes
        vmModels - the models of the vms that can be added to the nodes
        vmNames - for each model i , node name [i][j], vm model[k], the list of vms of that model to add to the node named j
        Returns:
        this

      • bunchOfVMs

        public static ArrayList<VirtualMachine> bunchOfVMs(String prefix,
                                   int number,
                                   int RAM,
                                   int avgCPU,
                                   double variation)
        creates several VMS, with the avg CPU of the group given, as well as the variation around this average
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix of the names of he VMS. Each VM is named prefix_[idx], idx from 0 to number-1
        number - the number of VMs to create
        RAM - the memory size of the VMs
        avgCPU - the average CPU utilization of the VMs
        variation - the max distance to avg a VM's CPU can be. eg, if 1, then the lowest CPU VM will have 0 used CPU, while the highest CPU VM will have 2*avgCPU
        Returns:
        a new modifiable arraylist of VMS

      • makeName

        protected static String makeName(String prefix,
              int num,
              int idxSize)
        make a name prefix_num, such as the num part is of given length
        Parameters:
        prefix - the prefix of the string
        num - the number to append to the prefix
        idxSize - the number of digits the num part of the name must reach.
        Returns:
        a new String composed of prefix, a set of "0", and num, with the number of "0" and digits of num being idxSize.
